description: 20 prompts covering node types and patterns underrepresented in the training data: ForEachLoop, SpawnActor, Timeline, Casting, Arrays, Custom Events, Multiple Events, Variables, Math operations.

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that prints Hello World when the game starts.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HelloWorld
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Hello World"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint for an actor that continuously rotates at 90 degrees per second on the Yaw axis.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_RotatingActor
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: MakeRotator [X=0, Y=0, Z=90]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat
NODE n4: AddActorLocalRotation

EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute

DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.B [Rotator]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.DeltaRotation [Rotator]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that prints Entered when another actor overlaps it and prints Exited when the overlap ends.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_OverlapZone
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Entered"]
NODE n3: Event_ActorEndOverlap
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Exited"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with a boolean variable IsActive. On BeginPlay, check if IsActive is true. If true, print Active. If false, print Inactive.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_BranchExample
PARENT: Actor

VAR IsActive: Bool = true

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Branch
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Active"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Inactive"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.True -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.False -> n4.Execute

DATA n1.IsActive -> n2.Condition [Bool]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that waits 3 seconds after the game starts, then destroys itself.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TimedDestroy
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n3: DestroyActor

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay uses a Sequence node to first print Step 1, then print Step 2, then print Step 3.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SequenceExample
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Sequence
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Step 1"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Step 2"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Step 3"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_2 -> n5.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that toggles an actor's visibility each time the player presses the Interact input action using a FlipFlop node.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleVisibility
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetActorHiddenInGame [NewHidden=false]
NODE n4: SetActorHiddenInGame [NewHidden=true]

EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that prints Welcome only the first time the player overlaps with the actor using a DoOnce node.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_WelcomeOnce
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: DoOnce
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Welcome"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap, casts the other actor to a Character class. If the cast succeeds, print Player Found.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CastExample
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Player Found"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n3.Execute

DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with an array of Actors called TargetActors. On BeginPlay, loop through each actor in the array and destroy it.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DestroyAll
PARENT: Actor

VAR TargetActors: Array = None

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForEachLoop
NODE n3: DestroyActor

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute

DATA n1.TargetActors -> n2.Array [Array]
DATA n2.ArrayElement -> n3.Target [Actor]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with a Gate node. On BeginPlay, open the gate. On Tick, pass through the gate and print Ticking. On pressing the Close input action, close the gate.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GateExample
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_Tick
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Ticking"]
NODE n5: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Close"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Then -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Pressed -> n2.Close

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with a custom event called OnActivate. On BeginPlay, call the custom event. The custom event prints Activated when called.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CustomEventExample
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: CallEvent [EventName="OnActivate"]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName="OnActivate"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Activated"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with an integer variable Score starting at 0. On overlap, add 10 to the score and print the new score.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ScoreCounter
PARENT: Actor

VAR Score: Int = 0

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: GetVariable [VarName="Score"]
NODE n3: AddInt
NODE n4: SetVariable [VarName="Score"]
NODE n5: PrintString

EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute

DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Int]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Value [Int]
DATA n4.Value -> n5.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that spawns a projectile actor at the player's location when the Fire input action is pressed.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ProjectileSpawner
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: GetActorRotation
NODE n4: SpawnActor [ActorClass="BP_Projectile"]

EXEC n1.Pressed -> n4.Execute

DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n4.SpawnLocation [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.SpawnRotation [Rotator]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that plays a sound effect when the actor is overlapped by another actor.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SoundOnOverlap
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: PlaySound [Sound="OverlapSound"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute

DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Location [Vector]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick, gets the distance to another actor stored in a variable called TargetActor. If the distance is less than 500, print Close.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DistanceChecker
PARENT: Actor

VAR TargetActor: Actor = None

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetDistanceTo
NODE n3: LessThanFloat
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Close"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute

DATA n1.TargetActor -> n2.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that prints Started on BeginPlay, prints Tick Count each frame using Event Tick, and prints Goodbye before the actor is destroyed using Event EndPlay.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LifecycleEvents
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Started"]
NODE n3: Event_Tick
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Tick Count"]
NODE n5: Event_EndPlay
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Goodbye"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with a boolean variable IsVisible starting as true. On pressing Toggle input, flip IsVisible and call SetActorHiddenInGame with the new value.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_VisibilityToggle
PARENT: Actor

VAR IsVisible: Bool = true

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Toggle"]
NODE n2: GetVariable [VarName="IsVisible"]
NODE n3: NotBool
NODE n4: SetVariable [VarName="IsVisible"]
NODE n5: SetActorHiddenInGame

EXEC n1.Pressed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute

DATA n2.Value -> n3.Input [Bool]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Value [Bool]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n5.NewHidden [Bool]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay calculates the result of (5 + 3) multiplied by 2 and prints the result.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MathExample
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: AddFloat [A=5.0, B=3.0]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=2.0]
NODE n4: PrintString

EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute

DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay prints Ready, waits 2 seconds, prints Set, waits 1 second, then prints Go.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Countdown
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Ready"]
NODE n3: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Set"]
NODE n5: Delay [Duration=1.0]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Go"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Completed -> n6.Execute
